meanings.definition: To embrace someone or something tightly with one's arms.
meanings.sent1: I hug my teddy bear every night before bed.
meanings.sent2: She hugged her friend to show she cared.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to hug the fence with its branches.
meanings.sent4: The warm scarf hugged her neck on the cold day.
meanings.sent5: The child ran to hug his mom after a long day at school.

meanings.definition: A tight hold around someone or something with one's arms.
meanings.sent1: He gave her a big hug when they finally met.
meanings.sent2: The hug from the giant panda at the zoo was unforgettable.
meanings.sent3: The hug of the octopus tentacles around the ship was surprisingly gentle.
meanings.sent4: The hug of the mountain range around the valley was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The hug of the cozy blanket on a chilly evening was comforting.
